file_content.text: Chancellor.
Darth Marr. You wanted a word?
I'm sure you have questions for me about the status of our invasion, but first I have questions for you.
I couldn't make that out. Could you repeat?
Can't hear you, Marr. Probably on your end.
What can you tell me about these possessions? Theron Shan seems to think that, while it was an isolated matter at first--
I'm curious: Do you really believe you've accomplished anything here? What do you think you've stopped?
Your bid for immortality.
I won't let you butcher innocent people--or anyone else, for that matter.
The endless bloodshed.
Nothing--but I had to try.
You feed on all the deaths you cause. I'm doing everything I can to take that away from you.
Your power supply.
You would feed on every last life in the galaxy to become immortal. I won't let that happen.
I'm not going to let you kill every living thing just so you can live forever.
I know how powerful you've become. But if I do nothing, what good am I?
Like I'm really just going to kick back and take a load off while you eat the galaxy.
Power-hungry maniacs can't be left to just do whatever they want.
You might as well, for all the actual progress you have made here.
I have decided that life is more interesting with you in it. If you wish to keep railing against me, then so be it. Your interference changes nothing.
When I am finished here--when every life on this world has been exhausted--I want you to be alive. To know that I succeeded.
I have already cheated death. I have other plans now--as you will see.
You could be so much more if you would let go your quaint morality. I'll even give you the chance.
"Everything you can" will never be enough. You would be wise to remember that from now on.
Noble. Pointless, but noble.
Indeed--what good are you? It is a question I have asked myself--and have finally answered.
Goodbye.
